AdditionalIdentification.description: Use this object when you need to provide an identification number other than or in addition to the member ID. For example, you may provide the patient account number. Don't include the health insurance claim number or the medicaid recipient ID number here unless they are different from the member ID.

policyNumber.description: The insurance group or policy number.

memberIdentificationNumber.description: The member identification number. Use only when checking eligibility with a Workers' Compensation or Property and Casualty insurer.

contractNumber.description: The contract number for an existing contract between the payer and the provider requesting the eligibility check.

identificationCardSerialNumber.description: The identification card serial number. You can include this when the ID card has a number in addition to the member ID number. The Identification Card Serial Number uniquely identifies the card when multiple cards have been or will be issued to a member, such as a replacement card.

agencyClaimNumber.description: The Property and Casualty Claim Number associated with the patient. You should only submit this value when when you are submitting an eligibility request to a property and casualty payer.

description.description: A free-form message containing additional information about the benefits in the response.

address1.description: The first line of the address.

address2.description: The second line of the address.

state.description: The state code. For example, TN for Tennessee or WA for Washington.

postalCode.description: The United States postal code, excluding punctuation and blanks.

countryCode.description: The country code. Use the alpha-2 country codes from Part 1 of ISO 3166.

countrySubDivisionCode.description: The country subdivision code. Use the country subdivision codes from Part 2 of ISO 3166.

AdjustmentGroupCode.description: Loop: 2430, Segment: CAS, Element: CAS01, Notes: Code identifying the general category of payment adjustment

conditionCodes.description: Loop: 2300, Segment: CRC, Element: CRC03, CRC04, CRC05, CRC06, CRC07, Note: Allowed Values are: '01' Patient was admitted to a hospital, '04' Patient was moved by stretcher, '05' Patient was unconscious or in shock, '06' Patient was transported in an emergency situation, '07' Patient had to be physically restrained, '08' Patient had visible hemorrhaging, '09' Ambulance service was medically necessary, '12' Patient is confined to a bed or chair

AmbulanceCertificationCertificationCondi.description: Loop: 2300, Segment: CRC, Element: CRC02 when CRC01 = 07, Note: Allowed Values are: 'N' No, 'Y' Yes

AmbulanceCertificationConditionCodesItem.description: Loop: 2300, Segment: CRC, Element: CRC03, CRC04, CRC05, CRC06, CRC07, Note: Allowed Values are: '01' Patient was admitted to a hospital, '04' Patient was moved by stretcher, '05' Patient was unconscious or in shock, '06' Patient was transported in an emergency situation, '07' Patient had to be physically restrained, '08' Patient had visible hemorrhaging, '09' Ambulance service was medically necessary, '12' Patient is confined to a bed or chair

AmbulanceTransportReasonCode.description: CR104, Note: Allowed Values are: 'A' Patient was transported to nearest facility for care of symptoms, complaints, or both, 'B' Patient was transported for the benefit of a preferred physician, 'C' Patient was transported for the nearness of family members, 'D' Patient was transported for the care of a specialist or for availability of specialized equipment, 'E' Patient Transferred to Rehabilitation Facility

AttachmentReportTypeCode.description: Loop: 2400, Segment: PWK, Element: PWK01, Notes: Allowed Values are: '03' Report Justifying Treatment Beyond Utilization Guidelines, '04' Drugs Administered, '05' Treatment Diagnosis, '06' Initial Assessment, '07' Functional Goals, '08' Plan of Treatment, '09' Progress Report, '10' Continued Treatment, '11' Chemical Analysis, '13' Certified Test Report, '15' Justification for Admission, '21' Recovery Plan, 'A3' Allergies/Sensitivities Document, 'A4' Autopsy Report, 'AM' Ambulance Certification, 'AS' Admission Summary, 'B2' Prescription, 'B3' Physician Order, 'B4' Referral Form, 'BR' Benchmark Testing Results, 'BS' Baseline, 'BT' Blanket Test Results, 'CB' Chiropractic Justification, 'CK' Consent Form(s), 'CT' Certification, 'D2' Drug Profile Document, 'DA' Dental Models, 'DB' Durable Medical Equipment Prescription, 'DG' Diagnostic Report, 'DJ' Discharge Monitoring Report, 'DS' Discharge Summary, 'EB' Explanation of Benefits (Coordination of Benefits or Medicare Secondary Payor), 'HC' Health Certificate, 'HR' Health Clinic Records, 'I5' Immunization Record,'IR' State School Immunization Records, 'LA' Laboratory Results, 'M1' Medical Record Attachment, 'MT' Models, 'NM Nursing Notes', 'OB' Operative Note, 'OC' Oxygen Content Averaging Report, 'OD' Orders and Treatments Document, 'OE' Objective Physical Examination (including vital signs) Document, 'OX' Oxygen Therapy Certification, 'OZ' Support Data for Claim, 'P4' Pathology Report, 'P5' Patient Medical History Document, 'PE' Parenteral or Enteral Certification, 'PN' Physical Therapy Notes, 'PO' Prosthetics or Orthotic Certification, 'PQ' Paramedical Results, 'PY' Physician's Report, 'PZ' Physical Therapy Certification, 'RB' Radiology Films, 'RR' Radiology Reports, 'RT' Report of Tests and Analysis Report, 'RX' Renewable Oxygen Content Averaging Report, 'SG' Symptoms Document, 'V5' Death Notification, 'XP' Photographs

AutoAccidentStateCode.description: Loop 2300, Segment: CLM, Element: CLM11-04, Note: When CLM11-1 or CLM11-2 has a value of 'AA' to identify the state, province or sub-country code in which the automobile accident occurred.

BenefitsAdditionalInformation.description: Identifying information specific to this type of benefit.

BenefitsDateInformation.description: Dates associated with the benefits. All fields may either be expressed as a single date, formatted as YYYYMMDD or as a range of dates, formatted as YYYYMMDD-YYYYMMDD.

code.description: The eligibility or benefit information code. The following codes indicate patient responsibility: `A` - Co-Insurance, `B` - Co-payment, `C` - Deductible, `G`- Out of Pocket (Stop Loss), `J` - Non-Covered, and `Y`- Spend Down. Visit `EB01` in Stedi's [X12 X279 270/271 guide](https://www.stedi.com/app/guides/view/hipaa/health-care-eligibility-benefit-response-x279a1/01GS66YHZPB37ABF34DBPSR213#properties.detail.properties.information_source_level_HL_loop.items.properties.information_receiver_level_HL_loop.items.properties.subscriber_level_HL_loop.items.properties.subscriber_name_NM1_loop.properties.subscriber_eligibility_or_benefit_information_EB_loop.items.properties.subscriber_eligibility_or_benefit_information_EB) for a complete list of codes.

name.description: The name of the benefit information code. For example, `Deductible`.

coverageLevelCode.description: Code indicating the level of coverage for the patient. Can be set to `CHD` - Children Only, `DEP` - Dependents Only, `ECH` - Employee and Children, `EMP` - Employee Only, `ESP` - Employee and Spouse, `FAM` - Family, `IND` - Individual, `SPC` - Spouse and Children, or `SPO` - Spouse Only.

coverageLevel.description: The name of the coverage level code. For example `Individual`.

serviceTypeCodes.description: Codes identifying the type of services. For example, `7` - Anesthesia.

serviceTypes.description: The full name of the listed `serviceTypeCodes`. For example `Psychiatric`, `Social Work`, etc. This may be empty if the payer sends unrecognized codes in the response.

insuranceTypeCode.description: Code identifying the type of insurance policy. For example `MC` - Medicaid.

insuranceType.description: The name of the insurance type code. For example `Medicaid`.

planCoverage.description: The specific product name or special program name for an insurance plan. For example `Gold 1-2-3`.

timeQualifierCode.description: Code indicating the time period for the benefit information. For example `23` - Calendar Year.

timeQualifier.description: The name of the time period qualifier code. For example `Calendar Year`.

benefitAmount.description: The monetary amount of the benefit, such as a patient's co-pay or deductible. For example, `100.00`.

benefitPercent.description: The percentage of the benefit, such as co-insurance. The percentage is expressed as a decimal. For example, `0.80` equals 80%.

quantityQualifierCode.description: Code indicating the type of quantity for the benefit. For example `VS` - Visits.

quantityQualifier.description: The name of the quantity qualifier code. For example, `Visits`.

benefitQuantity.description: The quantity of the benefit, qualified by the type specified in `quantityQualifier`. For example, `10` when the `quantityQualifier` is `Visits`.

authOrCertIndicator.description: Code indicating whether the benefit is subject to prior authorization or certification. can be `Y` - Yes, `N` - No or `U` - Unknown.

inPlanNetworkIndicatorCode.description: Code indicating whether the benefit is in-network or out-of-network. Can be `Y` - Yes, `N` - No, `U` - Unknown, or `W` - Not Applicable (when benefits are the same regardless or the plan network does not apply to the benefit).

inPlanNetworkIndicator.description: The name of the in-plan network indicator code. For example, `Yes`.

headerLoopIdentifierCode.description: The loop header identifier number in the `LS` segment of the original X12 EDI transaction.

trailerLoopIdentifierCode.description: The loop trailer identifier number in the `LE` segment of the original X12 EDI transaction.

benefitsRelatedEntities.description: All other entities associated with the eligibility or benefits.

benefitsServiceDelivery.description: The delivery or usage pattern for the benefits.

eligibilityAdditionalInformationList.description: Used when there are multiple Nature of Injury Codes or a Facility Type Codes included in the response.

BenefitsRelatedEntity.description: Identify another entity associated with the eligibility or benefits. This could be a provider, an individual, an organization, or another payer.

entityIdentifier.description: Code identifying an organizational entity, a physical location, property or an individual. Can be set to `1I` - Preferred Provider Organization (PPO),  `1P` - Provider, `2B` - Third-Party Administrator, `13` - Contracted Service Provider, `36` - Employer, `73` - Other Physician, `FA` - Facility, `GP` - Gateway Provider, `GW` - Group, `I3` - Independent Physicians Association (IPA), `IL` - Insured or Subscriber, `LR` - Legal Representative, `OC` - Origin Carrier, `P3` - Primary Care Provider, `P4` - Prior Insurance Carrier, `P5` - Plan Sponsor, `PR` - Payer, `PRP` - Primary Payer, `SEP` - Secondary Payer, `TTP` - Tertiary Payer, `VER` - Party Performing Verification, `VN` - Vendor, `VY` - Organization Completing Configuration Change, `X3` - Utilization Management Organization, `Y2` - Managed Care Organization.

entityType.description: The type of entity. Can be `1` - Person or `2` - Non-Person Entity.

entityName.description: The last name (if the entity is a person) or the business name (if the entity is an organization).

entityFirstname.description: The first name of the entity, if the entity is a person.

entityMiddlename.description: The middle name or initial of the entity, if the entity is a person.

entitySuffix.description: The name suffix, such as Sr. Jr. or III.

entityIdentification.description: Code identifying the type of value provided in `entityIdentificationValue`. For example, `FI` - Federal Taxpayer's Identification Number.

entityIdentificationValue.description: The identification number for the entity, qualified by the code in `entityIdentification`.

entityRelationship.description: Code specifying the relationship between the entity and the patient. Can be set to `01` - Parent, `02` - Child, `27` - Domestic Partner, `41` - Spouse, `48` - Employee, `65` - Other, or `72` - Unknown.

BenefitsServiceDelivery.description: The delivery or usage pattern for the benefits.

quantityQualifierCode.description: Code specifying the type of quantity. Can be set to `DY` - Days, `FL` - Units, `HS` - Hours, `MN` - Month, or `VS` - Visits.

quantityQualifier.description: The name of the `quantityQualifierCode`. For example, `Days`.

quantity.description: The quantity of the benefit. For example, `10` when the `quantityQualifier` is `Visits`.

unitForMeasurementCode.description: The name of the `unitForMeasurementQualifierCode`. For example, `Days`.

sampleSelectionModulus.description: Specifies the sampling frequency, based on the unit of measure. For example `every 2 months` or `once per calendar year`.

timePeriodQualifierCode.description: Code specifying the time period for the benefit information. Can be set to `6` - Hour, `7` - Day, `21` - Years, `22` - Service Year, `23` - Calendar Year, `24` - Year to Date, `25` - Contract, `26` - Episode, `27` - Visit, `28` - Outlier, `29` - Remaining, `30` - Exceeded, `31` - Not Exceeded, `32` - Lifetime, `33` - Lifetime Remaining, `34` - Month, or `35` - Week.

timePeriodQualifier.description: The name of the `timePeriodQualifierCode`. For example, `Calendar Year`.

numOfPeriods.description: The number of periods in the time period. For example, `12` when the `timePeriodQualifier` is `Hour`.

unitForMeasurementQualifierCode.description: Code specifying the unit of measurement for the quantity. Can be set to `DA` - Days, `MO` - Months, `VS` - Visit, `WK - Week, or `YR` - Years.

deliveryOrCalendarPatternQualifierCode.description: Code that specifies the routine shipments, deliveries, or calendar pattern. For example `9` - Last Working Day of Period.

deliveryOrCalendarPatternQualifier.description: The name of the `deliveryOrCalendarPatternCode`. For example, `Last Working Day of Period`.

deliveryPatternTimeQualifierCode.description: Code that specifies the time for routine shipments or deliveries. For example `E` - P.M.

deliveryPatternTimeQualifier.description: The name of the `deliveryPatternTimeCode`. For example, `P.M.`.

electronicDataInterChangeAccessNumber.description: Segment: PER, Element: PER04, PER06 or PER08, Notes: Payer's electronic data interchange access number. PER03=PER05=PER07=ED

beginningDateOfService.description: The date the service began, formatted as YYYYMMDD.

endDateOfService.description: The date the service ended, formatted as YYYYMMDD.

trackingNumber.description: This is the tracking number assigned to the claim status request. It is returned in the response as `claims.trackingNumber`. If the payer requires a tracking number and you do not supply one, Stedi generates a tracking number for you from a UUID.

tradingPartnerClaimNumber.description: The claim number assigned by the payer.

locationIdentifier.description: The application or location identifier. Required if the application or location system identifier is known.

billingType.description: The billing type reference ID. For example, the billing type for inpatient services is `111`.

patientAccountNumber.description: The patient account number provided by the service provider.

clearingHouseClaimNumber.description: The claim number provided by the clearinghouse.

submittedAmount.description: The total charges submitted for the claim. Note that not all payer systems retain the original submitted charges; they are sometimes changed during processing.

EligibilityAdditionalInformation.description: Identify the Nature of Injury Code or a Facility Type Code.

codeListQualifierCode.description: Identifies a specific industry code list. Can be `GR` - National Council on Compensation Insurance (NCCI) Nature of Injury Code, `NI` - Nature of Injury Code, or `ZZ` - Mutually Defined.

codeCategory.description: The code category. Always set to `44` - Nature of Injury.

submitterTransactionIdentifier.description: An internal ID or other value that you use to track the eligibility check within your company's business system. You can use any string value up to 50 characters.

controlNumber.description: An integer used to identify the transaction. It does not need to be globally unique. This value is returned in the response as `controlNumber`.

tradingPartnerServiceId.description: This is the Payer ID. Visit the [Payer Network](https://www.stedi.com/healthcare/network) for a complete list.

tradingPartnerName.description: The payer's name, such as Cigna or Aetna.

portalUsername.description: The username that the provider uses to log in to the payer's portal. This is not commonly used.

portalPassword.description: The password that the provider uses to log in to the payer's portal. This is not commonly used.

dependents.description: One or more dependents for which you want to retrieve benefits information. The patient qualifies as a dependent for eligibility checks when the patient is listed as a dependent on the subscribers insurance plan AND the payer cannot uniquely identify the patient through information outside the subscribers policy. For example, if the dependent has their own member ID number, you should identify them in the `subscriber` object instead.

controlNumber.description: The control number you sent in the original eligibility check request.

tradingPartnerServiceId.description: The Payer ID you sent in the original eligibility check request.

subscriberTraceNumbers.description: The unique identifier assigned to the transaction by either the payer or the entity that submitted the original eligibility check request.

dependents.description: Information about the dependents listed in the original eligibility check request.

benefitsInformation.description: Information about the subscriber or dependents' healthcare benefits. This includes coverage level (individual vs. family), coverage type (deductibles, copays, etc.), out of pocket maximums, and more.

errors.description: When a payer rejects your eligibility check, the response contains one or more 'AAA' errors that specify the reasons for the rejection and any recommended follow-up actions. [Learn more](https://www.stedi.com/docs/healthcare/eligibility-troubleshooting#payer-aaa-errors)

implementationTransactionSetSyntaxError.description: The implementation transaction set error code provided in `IK502` of the 999 transaction.

billerId.description: Billing id assigned to this request

applicationMode.description: Used to identify where this request can be found for support

traceId.description: Unique Id assigned to each request

outboundTraceId.description: The value provided in the `submitterTransactionIdentifier` field in the original eligibility check request.

controlNumber.description: The control number you sent in the original eligibility check request.

tradingPartnerServiceId.description: The Payer ID you sent in the original eligibility check request.

subscriberTraceNumbers.description: The unique identifier assigned to the transaction by either the payer or the entity that submitted the original eligibility check request.

dependents.description: Information about the dependents listed in the original eligibility check request.

benefitsInformation.description: Information about the subscriber or dependents' healthcare benefits. This includes coverage level (individual vs. family), coverage type (deductibles, copays, etc.), out of pocket maximums, and more.

errors.description: When a payer rejects your eligibility check, the response contains one or more 'AAA' errors that specify the reasons for the rejection and any recommended follow-up actions. [Learn more](https://www.stedi.com/docs/healthcare/eligibility-troubleshooting#payer-aaa-errors)

transactionSetAcknowledgement.description: The transaction set acknowledgment code provided in in the [X12 EDI 999 response](https://www.stedi.com/app/guides/view/hipaa/implementation-acknowledgment-x231/01HRF41ES1DVGCA6X1EHSRPFXZ#properties.heading.properties.transaction_set_response_header_AK2_loop.items.properties.transaction_set_response_trailer_IK5).

x12.description: The raw X12 EDI [271 Eligibility Benefit Response](https://www.stedi.com/app/guides/view/hipaa/health-care-eligibility-benefit-response-x279a1/01GS66YHZPB37ABF34DBPSR213) from the payer.

Encounter.description: Details about the eligibility or benefit information you are requesting for the patient. If you don't specify service date (either a single day or a range of dates), Stedi defaults to using the current date. If you don't specify either `serviceTypeCodes` or a `procedureCode` and `productOrServiceIDQualifier`, Stedi defaults to using `30` (Plan coverage and general benefits) as the only `serviceTypeCodes` value.

beginningDateOfService.description: The beginning date of service, formatted as YYYYMMDD. If you include this value, you must also include the `endDateOfService`.

endDateOfService.description: The end date of service, formatted as YYYYMMDD. If you include this value, you must also include the `beginningDateOfService`.

dateOfService.description: The date of service, formatted as YYYYMMDD. You can use this value to specify a single occasion, such as a doctor's visit.

serviceTypeCodes.description: One or more [service type codes](https://x12.org/codes/service-type-codes) classifying the type of services for which you want to receive benefits information. If you do not specify a service type code or a `procedureCode` and `productOrServiceIDQualifier`, Stedi defaults to using `30` - Health Benefit Plan Coverage. Not all payers support all service type codes. Codes with a **Start** date after 2009 are unlikely to be supported.

priorAuthorizationOrReferralNumber.description: The prior authorization or referral number for a particular benefit or procedure.

procedureModifiers.description: The procedure modifier that provides additional information related to the performance of the service.

medicalProcedures.description: Use only when you need to send multiple procedure codes in a single request. Otherwise, use the `encounter.procedureCode` and `encounter.productOrServiceIDQualifier` fields.

EncounterProductOrServiceIDQualifier.description: Code identifying the type/source of the `procedureCode`. You can set this to `AD` - American Dental Association Codes, `CJ` - Current Procedural Terminology (CPT) Codes, `HC` - Health Care Financing Administration Common Procedural Coding System (HCPCS) Codes, `ID` - International Classification of Diseases, 9th Revision, Clinical Modification (ICD-9-CM) - Procedure, `IV` - Home Infusion EDI Coalition (HIEC) Product/Service Code, `N4` - National Drug Code in 5-4-2 Format, or `ZZ` - Mutually Defined.

EncounterReferenceIdentificationQualifie.description: The type of information you provided in the `priorAuthorizationOrReferralNumber` field. You can set this to `9F` - Referral Number or `G1` - Prior Authorization Number.

conditionCodes.description: Loop: 2300, Segment: CRC, Elements: CRC03, CRC04, CRC05 Note: Allowed Values are: 'AV' Available- Not Used, 'NU' Not Used, 'S2' Under Treatment, 'ST' New Services Requested

Error.description: When a payer rejects your eligibility check, the response contains one or more AAA errors that specify the reasons for the rejection and any recommended follow-up actions. [Learn more](https://www.stedi.com/docs/healthcare/eligibility-troubleshooting#payer-aaa-errors)

followupAction.description: Allowed actions you can take, based on the rejection reason code. For example `Please Correct and Resubmit`.

location.description: The location of the error within the original X12 EDI response.

possibleResolutions.description: Information to help you correct the error.

code.description: Code for the error. Example: INVALID_VALUE

description.description: Description of the error code. Value provided in payer id should be a valid Optum assigned ERA payer ID

location.description: Segment/location where the error occurred. If this is a network/system error, there is no location attribute. Example: $.payerBenefits[0].payer

followupAction.description: Any follow action required for the error. For AAA errors, this would be value for AAA04

description.description: Description of the error code. Value provided in payer id should be a valid Optum assigned ERA payer Id.

HealthCareDiagnosisCode.description: Information about the patient's healthcare diagnosis.

diagnosisTypeCode.description: The type of diagnosis code provided. It can be `ABK` - International Classification of Diseases Clinical Modification (ICD-10-CM) Principal Diagnosis or `BK` - International Classification of Diseases Clinical Modification (ICD-9-CM) Principal Diagnosis.

diagnosisCode.description: The diagnosis code. The decimal points are omitted in diagnosis codes - the decimal point is assumed.

HealthCareInformation.description: Information about the subscriber's healthcare diagnosis.

diagnosisCode.description: The diagnosis code. Omit the decimal points in diagnosis codes - the decimal point is assumed.

IndividualRelationshipCode.description: The dependent's relationship to the subscriber. You can set this to `01` - Spouse, `19` - Child, `34` - Other Adult.

IndustryCode.description: The type of facility where the service was provided. You can set this to one of the [place of service codes](https://www.cms.gov/medicare/coding-billing/place-of-service-codes/code-sets).

InformationReceiverName.description: Provide additional information to identify the entity making the eligibility request. For example, if a provider has multiple locations, you may need to provide the address of the specific location.

stateLicenceNumber.description: The provider's state license number. If you include this information, you must also include the `informationReceiverAdditionalIdentifierState`.

facilityIdNumber.description: The ID number for the provider's facility.

devicePinNumber.description: The provider's electronic device pin number.

nationalProviderIdentifier.description: The provider's National Provider Identifier (NPI) from the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services.

providerPlanNetworkIdNumber.description: The provider's plan network identification number.

facilityNetworkIdNumber.description: The provider's facility network identification number.

socialSecurityNumber.description: The provider's social security number. Don't use this for Federally administered programs, such as Medicare.

federalTaxpayerIdentificationNumber.description: The provider's federal taxpayer identification number.

informationReceiverAdditionalIdentifierS.description: The two-character state ID of the state that assigned the `stateLicenseNumber`.

Payer.description: Information about the payer providing the benefits information and the organization receiving it.

entityIdentifier.description: The entity identifier code for the payer. Can be set to `2B` - Third-Party Administrator, `36` - Employer, `GP` - Gateway Provider, `P5` Plan Sponsor, or `PR` - Payer.

entityType.description: The entity type qualifier for the payer. Can be set to `1` - Person (not commonly used) or `2` - Non-Person Entity (most common).

firstName.description: The payer's first name. Used when the payer is an individual (not commonly used).

lastName.description: The payer's last name. Used when the payer is an individual (not commonly used).

name.description: The payer's business name. Used when the payer is not a person.

middleName.description: The payer's middle name or initial. Used when the payer is an individual (not commonly used).

suffix.description: The payer's name suffix, such as Jr. or III. Used when the payer is an individual (not commonly used).

employersId.description: Deprecated; The payer's identification number for the entity receiving the benefits information.

federalTaxpayersIdNumber.description: The payer's federal taxpayer's identification number.

naic.description: The payer's National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC) identification number.

centersForMedicareAndMedicaidPlanId.description: The payer's Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services PlanID.

aaaErrors.description: When a payer rejects your eligibility check, the response contains one or more `AAA` errors that specify the reasons for the rejection and any recommended follow-up actions. Common reasons for rejection at the `payer` level include issues with payer enrollment and that the payer's system is down or experiencing issues. [Learn more](https://www.stedi.com/docs/healthcare/eligibility-troubleshooting#payer-aaa-errors)

etin.description: The payer's Electronic Transmitter Identification Number (ETIN).

PlanDateInformation.description: Contains the dates associated with the subscriber's insurance plan. This information is used to determine the patient's eligibility for benefits. All dates are formatted as YYYYMMDD (for single dates) or as YYYYMMDD-YYYYMMDD (for date ranges). Fields contain a single date unless otherwise noted.

coordinationOfBenefits.description: Can be formatted either a single date, or as a range of dates in YYYYMMDD-YYYYMMDD format.

plan.description: Can be formatted as a single date or as a range of dates in YYYYMMDD-YYYYMMDD format. Used only if multiple plans apply to the individual or multiple plan periods apply. Dates listed only apply to the `benefitsInformation` object in which this `benefitsDateInformation` is provided.

benefit.description: Can be formatted as a single date or as a range of dates in YYYYMMDD-YYYYMMDD format.

eligibility.description: Can be formatted as a single date, or as a range of dates in YYYYMMDD-YYYYMMDD format.

planBegin.description: Used only if multiple plans apply to the individual or multiple plan periods apply. Dates listed only apply to the `benefitsInformation` object in which this `benefitsDateInformation` is provided.

admission.description: Formatted as YYYYMMDD (for single dates) or as YYYMMDD-YYYYMMDD (for date ranges).

service.description: Can be formatted as a single date, or as a range of dates in YYYYMMDD-YYYYMMDD format.

PlanInformation.description: Additional identification for the subscriber's healthcare plan.

memberId.description: The member identification number - only used when checking eligibility with a Workers' Compensation or Property and Casualty insurer.

alternativeListId.description: The alternative list ID - identifies a list of alternative drugs with the associated formulary status for the patient.

classOfContractCode.description: The class of contract code - used to identify the applicable class of contract for claims processing.

coverageListId.description: The coverage list ID - identifies a list of drugs that have coverage limitations for the patient.

contractNumber.description: The contract number of a contract between the payer and the provider that requested the eligibility check.

idCardSerialNumber.description: The identification card serial number. The Identification Card Serial Number uniquely identifies the identification card when multiple cards have been or will be issued to a member, such as a replacement card.

idCardNumber.description: The identity card number, used when the Identity Card Number is different than the Member Identification Number.

centersForMedicareAndMedicaidServicesNPI.description: The National Provider Identifier (NPI) assigned by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services

planNetworkIdDescription.description: The plan, group, or plan network name

agencyClaimNumber.description: The agency claim number, only used when the information source is a Property and Casualty payer.

Visit `C300301` in the [Claim Status specification](https://www.stedi.com/app/guides/view/hipaa/claim-status-request-x212/01GRYB6A4XEJQ61Y2K2KT606E5#properties.detail.properties.information_source_level_HL_loop.items.properties.information_receiver_level_HL_loop.items.properties.service_provider_level_HL_loop.items.properties.subscriber_level_HL_loop.items.properties.claim_status_tracking_number_TRN_loop.items.properties.service_line_information_SVC_loop.items.properties.service_line_information_SVC.properties.composite_medical_procedure_identifier_01.properties.product_or_service_id_qualifier_01) for a complete list.

Provider.description: Information about the entity requesting the eligibility check. This may be an individual practitioner, a medical group, a hospital, or another type of healthcare provider.  You must provide the `organizationName` (if the entity is an organization) or `firstName` and `lastName` (if the provider is an individual). You must also provide an identifier - this is typically the provider's National Provider ID (`npi`).

organizationName.description: The provider's business name. This field is required if the provider is not a person.

firstName.description: The provider's first name. This field is required if the provider is an individual.

lastName.description: The provider's last name. This field is required if the provider is an individual.

npi.description: The provider's National Provider Identifier (NPI). This identifier is required for all healthcare providers. If the provider doesn't have an NPI, you can use the `serviceProviderNumber` instead.

serviceProviderNumber.description: The provider's service provider number. Only use when the billing provider doesn't have an NPI. This is typically when the provider is a non-medical provider, such as a social worker, home health aide, or transportation service.

payorId.description: This is the Payer ID, and can either be provided as a Stedi Payer ID or a Change Healthcare Payer ID. Visit the [Payer Network](https://www.stedi.com/healthcare/network) for a complete list.

taxId.description: The provider's Federal Taxpayer Identification Number (also known as an EIN).

ssn.description: The provider's Social Security Number (SSN). Don't use this for Federally-administered programs, such as Medicare.

servicesPlanID.description: The provider's Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) Plan ID.

employersId.description: Deprecated; The submitter's Employer's Identification Number (EIN). Only use when an employer is checking the eligibility and benefits of their employees.

referenceIdentification.description: The provider's [Taxonomy Code](https://x12.org/codes/provider-taxonomy-codes). Only used when the provider's taxonomy code is relevant to the eligibility/benefit inquiry. For example, an institutional provider such as a hospital may need to use a taxonomy code to specify a specific unit or department.

The provider's taxonomy code. Can be set to `AD` - Admitting, `AT` - Attending, `BI` - Billing, `CO` - Consulting, `CV` - Covering, `H` - Hospital, `HH` - Home Health Care, `LA` - Laboratory, `OT` - Other Physician, `P1` - Pharmacist, `P2` - Pharmacy, `PC` - Primary Care Physician, `PE` - Performing, `R` - Rural Health Clinic, `RF` - Referring, `SB` - Submitting, `SK` - Skilled Nursing Facility, or `SU` - Supervising.

ProviderProviderCode.description: Communicate the provider's role in the type of benefits specified in the request. For example, you could set this to `RF` if the provider is also the referring provider. You can use one of the following: `AD` - Admitting, `AT` - Attending, `BI` - Billing, `CO` - Consulting, `CV` - Covering, `H` - Hospital, `HH` - Home Health Care, `LA` - Laboratory, `OT` - Other Physician, `P1` - Pharmacist, `P2` - Pharmacy, `PC` - Primary Care Physician, `PE` - Performing, `R` - Rural Health Clinic, `RF` - Referring, `SB` - Submitting, `SK` - Skilled Nursing Facility, `SU` - Supervising

birthSequenceNumber.description: The number assigned to each family member born with the same birth date, such as twins or triplets. Use to indicate the birth order when there are multiple births associated with the provided birth date.

issueNumber.description: The issue number for the dependent's insurance policy.

eligibilityCategory.description: The eligibility category for the dependent.

memberId.description: Only use for property and casualty use cases when the property and casualty patient identifier is a member ID and would be used in an 837 healthcare claim submission.

firstName.description: The dependent's first name. Can be 0-35 alphanumeric characters.

middleName.description: The dependent's middle name or middle initial. Can be 0-25 alphanumeric characters.

lastName.description: The dependent's last name. Can be 0-60 alphanumeric characters.

suffix.description: The dependent's name suffix, such as Sr. or III. Can be 0-10 alphanumeric characters.

dateOfBirth.description: The dependent's date of birth in YYYYMMDD format.

ssn.description: The dependent's social security number. Can be 0-50 alphanumeric characters. Don't use this for Federally-administered programs, such as Medicare.

groupNumber.description: The group number for the dependent's insurance plan. Can be 0-50 alphanumeric characters.

providerIdentifier.description: The provider identifier you specified in the `referenceIdentificationQualifier` field. For example, the provider's National Provider ID or Federal Taxpayer Identification number. If you set the `referenceIdentificationQualifier` to `PXC`, then this field should contain the provider's taxonomy code.

beginningCardIssueDate.description: Deprecated; The date the insurance card was issued, expressed in YYYYMMDD format.

endCardIssueDate.description: Deprecated; The date the insurance card expires, expressed in YYYYMMDD format.

idCardIssueDate.description: Deprecated; The date the identification card was issued, expressed in YYYYMMDD format.

planIssueDate.description: Deprecated; The date the insurance plan was issued, expressed in YYYYMMDD format.

beginningPlanIssueDate.description: Deprecated; The date the insurance plan begins, expressed in YYYYMMDD format.

endPlanIssueDate.description: Deprecated; The date the insurance plan ends, expressed in YYYYMMDD format.

healthCareCodeInformation.description: Information about the dependent's health care diagnosis.

RequestDependentProviderCode.description: Use this for providers that are not requesting the eligibility check - the requestor is specified in the `provider` object. For example, if you are a hospital making an eligibility request, this is where you would specify information about a referring provider's role. You can use one of the following: `AD` - Admitting, `AT` - Attending, `BI` - Billing, `CO` - Consulting, `CV` - Covering, `H` - Hospital, `HH` - Home Health Care, `LA` - Laboratory, `OT` - Other Physician, `P1` - Pharmacist, `P2` - Pharmacy, `PC` - Primary Care Physician, `PE`- Performing, `R`- Rural Health Clinic, `RF` - Referring, `SB` - Submitting, `SK` - Skilled Nursing Facility, `SU` - Supervising

RequestDependentReferenceIdentificationQ.description: The type of `providerIdentifier` you are using. Use for providers that are not requesting the eligiblity check, such as the referring provider. Set to `HPI` when the National Provider ID is mandated for use. If identifying a type of specialty associated with services provided to the dependent, use code `PXC`. Otherwise, you can set to the following: `9K`- Servicer, `D3`- National Council for Prescription Drug Programs Pharmacy Number, `EI`- Employer's Identification Number, `HPI`- Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services National Provider Identifier, `PXC`- Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code, `SY`- Social Security Number, `TJ`- Federal Taxpayer's Identification Number

RequestSubscriber.description: The person who is the primary policyholder for the insurance plan. You only need to supply the fields necessary for your use case and for the provider to identify the subscriber in their system. All payers must be able to search for patients when you provide all of the following information: member ID, first name, last name, date of birth. Some payers may be able to search with less information, but this varies by payer. We recommend always including the patient's member ID when possible.

birthSequenceNumber.description: The number assigned to each family member born with the same birth date, such as twins or triplets. Use to indicate the birth order when there are multiple births associated with the provided birth date.

caseNumber.description: The case number associated with the subscriber.

medicaidRecipientIdentificationNumber.description: The Medicaid Recipient Identification Number. You can provide this number to identify the subscriber when it is the primary number the payer knows a member by (such as for Medicare or Medicaid). Do not supply this value unless it is different from the `memberId`.

spendDownAmount.description: Identify the dollar amount the subscriber will apply toward their spend down amount, if required. For some Medicaid programs, individuals must pay a certain amount towards their healthcare cost (spend down) before coverage starts.

spendDownTotalBilledAmount.description: The subscriber's spend down total billed amount.

coverageLevelCode.description: This field is no longer used.

memberId.description: The member ID for the subscriber's insurance policy.

firstName.description: The patient's first name. Can be 0-35 alphanumeric characters.

middleName.description: The patient's middle name or middle initial. Can be 0-25 alphanumeric characters.

lastName.description: The subscriber's last name. Can be 0-60 alphanumeric characters.

suffix.description: The name suffix, such as Jr., Sr., or III. Can be 0-10 alphanumeric characters.

dateOfBirth.description: The subscriber's date of birth in YYYYMMDD format.

ssn.description: The subscriber's Social Security Number (SSN). Don't use this for Federally administered programs, such as Medicare.

groupNumber.description: The group number associated with the subscriber's insurance policy.

idCard.description: The subscriber's identification card number. Include this field when this number is different than the subscriber's member ID. This is common in Medicaid.

providerIdentifier.description: The provider identifier you specified in the `referenceIdentificationQualifier` field. For example, the provider's National Provider ID or Federal Taxpayer Identification number. If you set the `referenceIdentificationQualifier` to `PXC`, then this field should contain the provider's taxonomy code.

beginningCardIssueDate.description: Deprecated; The date the subscriber's identification card was issued, expressed in YYYYMMDD format.

endCardIssueDate.description: Deprecated; The date the subscriber's identification card expires, expressed in YYYYMMDD format.

idCardIssueDate.description: Deprecated; The date the subscriber's identification card was issued, expressed in YYYYMMDD format.

planIssueDate.description: Deprecated; The date the subscriber's insurance plan was issued, expressed in YYYYMMDD format.

beginningPlanIssueDate.description: Deprecated; The date the subscriber's insurance plan was issued, expressed in YYYYMMDD format.

endPlanIssueDate.description: Deprecated; The date the subscriber's insurance plan ended, expressed in YYYYMMDD format.

healthCareCodeInformation.description: Information about the subscriber's health care diagnosis.

RequestSubscriberProviderCode.description: Use this for providers that are not requesting the eligibility check - the requestor is specified in the `provider` object. For example, if you are a hospital making an eligibility request, this is where you would specify information about a referring provider's role. You can use one of the following: `AD` - Admitting, `AT` - Attending, `BI` - Billing, `CO` - Consulting, `CV` - Covering, `H` - Hospital, `HH` - Home Health Care, `LA` - Laboratory, `OT` - Other Physician, `P1` - Pharmacist, `P2` - Pharmacy, `PC` - Primary Care Physician, `PE` - Performing, `R` - Rural Health Clinic, `RF` - Referring, `SB` - Submitting, `SK` - Skilled Nursing Facility, `SU` - Supervising

RequestSubscriberReferenceIdentification.description: Use this for providers that are not requesting the eligibility check. This is the type of `providerIdentifier` you are providing. Set to `HPI` when the National Provider ID is mandated for use. If identifying a type of specialty associated with services provided to the subscriber, use code `PXC`. Otherwise, you can set to the following: `9K`- Servicer, `D3`- National Council for Prescription Drug Programs Pharmacy Number, `EI`- Employer's Identification Number, `HPI`- Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services National Provider Identifier, `PXC`- Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code, `SY`- Social Security Number, `TJ`- Federal Taxpayer's Identification Number

ResponseMember.description: Information about the primary policyholder for the insurance plan listed in the original eligibility check request.

memberId.description: The member ID for the subscriber's insurance policy.

middleName.description: The patient's middle name or initial.

suffix.description: The name suffix, such as Jr., Sr., or III.

entityIdentifier.description: The entity identifier for the patient. It can be set to `IL` - Insured or Subscriber, or `03` - Dependent.

entityType.description: The entity type for the patient. It can be set to `1` for Person.

dateOfBirth.description: The patient's date of birth, formatted as YYYMMDD.

informationStatusCode.description: The status of the patient's information, used to report military service data. Can be set to `A` - Partial, `C` - Current, `L` - Latest, `O` - Oldest, `P` - Prior, `S` - Second Most Current, or `T` - Third Most Current.

employmentStatusCode.description: The patient's employment status code, used to report military service data. Can be set to `AE` - Active Reserve, `AO` - Active Military - Overseas, `AS` - Academy Student, `AT` - Presidential Appointee, `AU` - Active Military - USA, `CC` - Contractor, `DD` - Dishonorably Discharged, `HD` - Honorably Discharged, `IR` - Inactive Reserves, `LX` - Leave of Absence: Military, `PE` - Plan to Enlist, `RE` - Recommissioned, `RM` - Retired Military - Overseas, `RR`- Retired Without Recall, or `RU` - Retired Military - USA.

governmentServiceAffiliationCode.description: The patient's government service affiliation code, used to report military service data. Can be set to `A` - Air Force, `B` - Air Force Reserves, `C` - Army, `D` - Army Reserves, `E` - Coast Guard, `F` - Marine Corps, `G` - Marine Corps Reserves, `H` - National Guard, `I` - Navy, `J` - Navy Reserves, `K` - Other, `L`- Peace Corp, `M` - Regular Armed Forces, `N` - Reserves, `O` - U.S. Public Health Service, `Q` - Foreign Military, `R` - American Red Cross, `S` - Department of Defense, `U` - United States Organization, `W` - Military Sealift Command.

description.description: Context that identifies the exact military unit. Used to report military service data.

militaryServiceRankCode.description: The patient's military service rank code. Can be set to `A1` - Admiral, `A2` - Airman, `A3` - Airman First Class, `B1` - Basic Airman, `B2` - Brigadier General, `C1` - Captain, `C2` - Chief Master Sergeant, `C3` - Chief Petty Officer, `C4` - Chief Warrant, `C5` - Colonel, `C6` - Commander, `C7` - Commodore, `C8` - Corporal, `C9` - Corporal Specialist 4, `E1` - Ensign, `F1` - First Lieutenant, `F2` - First Sergeant, `F3` - First Sergeant-Master Sergeant, `F4` - Fleet Admiral, `G1` - General, `G4` - Gunnery Sergeant, `L1` - Lance Corporal, `L2` - Lieutenant, `L3` - Lieutenant Colonel, `L4` - Lieutenant Commander, `L5` - Lieutenant General, `L6` - Lieutenant Junior Grade, `M1` - Major, `M2` - Major General, `M3` - Master Chief Petty Officer, `M4` - Master Gunnery Sergeant Major, `M5` - Master Sergeant, `M6` - Master Sergeant Specialist 8, `P1` - Petty Officer First Class, `P2` - Petty Officer Second Class, `P3` - Petty Officer Third Class, `P4` - Private, `P5` - Private First Class, `R1` - Rear Admiral, `R2` - Recruit, `S1` - Seaman, `S2` - Seaman Apprentice, `S3` - Seaman Recruit, `S4` - Second Lieutenant, `S5` - Senior Chief Petty Officer, `S6` - Senior Master Sergeant, `S7` - Sergeant, `S8` - Sergeant First Class Specialist 7, `S9` - Sergeant Major Specialist 9, `SA` - Sergeant Specialist 5, `SB` - Staff Sergeant, `SC` - Staff Sergeant Specialist 6, `T1` - Technical Sergeant, `V1` - Vice Admiral, `W1` - Warrant Officer.

dateTimePeriodFormatQualifier.description: The format of the date and time period. Can be set to `D8` - Date or `RD8` - Range of Dates.

endDateTimePeriod.description: The end of a time period, formatted as YYYYMMDD.

startDateTimePeriod.description: The start of a time period, formatted as YYYYMMDD.

groupNumber.description: The group number associated with the subscriber's insurance policy.

planNumber.description: The plan number associated with the subscriber's insurance policy.

planNetworkIdNumber.description: The network identification number associated with the subscriber's insurance policy.

relationToSubscriber.description: The name of the `relationToSubscriberCode`. For example `Self` when the code is set to `18`.

relationToSubscriberCode.description: For the subscriber, this is set to `18` for Self. For dependents, it can be set to `01` - Spouse, `19` - Child, `20` Employee, `21` - Unknown, `39` - Organ Donor, `40` - Cadaver Donor, `53` - Life Partner, or `G8` - Other Relationship.

insuredIndicator.description: Indicates the status of the insured. A `Y` value indicates the insured is a subscriber. When set to `N`, the insured is a dependent.

maintenanceTypeCode.description: The maintenance type code. Used to acknowledge a change in the identifying elements for the patient from those submitted in the original eligibility check request. It can also be included when the payer used the birth sequence number from the original request to locate the subscriber in their system. Set to `001` - Change.

maintenanceReasonCode.description: Code identifying the reason for the changes to patient identifying information, such as name, date of birth, or address. Set to `25` - Change in Identifying Data Elements.

birthSequenceNumber.description: The number assigned to each family member born with the same birth date, such as twins or triplets. Indicates the birth order when there are multiple births associated with the provided birth date.

aaaErrors.description: When a payer rejects your eligibility check, the response contains one or more `AAA` errors that specify the reasons for the rejection and any recommended follow-up actions. [Learn more](https://www.stedi.com/docs/healthcare/eligibility-troubleshooting#payer-aaa-errors)

ResponseMemberGender.description: Code indiciating the patient's gender. Can be `F` - Female, `M` - Male, or `U` - Unknown.

traceId.description: This is the file execution ID, a unique identifier assigned to the processed file within the Stedi platform.

applicationMode.description: Used by to identify where this request can be found for support

ResponseProvider.description: Information about the entity that submitted the original eligibility check request. This may be an individual practitioner, a medical group, a hospital, or another type of healthcare provider.

providerName.description: The provider's last name. This applies to providers that are an individual.

providerFirstName.description: The provider's first name. This applies to providers that are an individual.

middleName.description: The provider's middle name. This applies to providers that are an individual.

suffix.description: The provider's name suffix, such as Jr., Sr., or III.

entityIdentifier.description: A code identifying the type of provider. Can be `1P` - Provider, `2B` - Third-Party Administrator, `36` - Employer, `80` - Hospital, `FA` - Facility, `GP` - Gateway Provider, `P5` - Plan Sponsor, or `PR` - Payer.

entityType.description: A code identifying the type of entity. Can be `1` - Person or `2` - Non-Person Entity.

providerCode.description: A code that communicates the provider's role in the type of benefits information in the response. Can be one of the following: `AD` - Admitting, `AT` - Attending, `BI` - Billing, `CO` - Consulting, `CV` - Covering, `H` - Hospital, `HH` - Home Health Care, `LA` - Laboratory, `OT` - Other Physician, `P1` - Pharmacist, `P2` - Pharmacy, `PC` - Primary Care Physician, `PE` - Performing, `R` - Rural Health Clinic, `RF` - Referring, `SB` - Submitting, `SK` - Skilled Nursing Facility, `SU` - Supervising.

referenceIdentification.description: The Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code.

employersId.description: Deprecated; The Employer's Identification Number (EIN). Only used when an employer is checking the eligibility and benefits of their employees.

federalTaxpayersIdNumber.description: The Federal Taxpayer Identification Number (also known as an EIN).

serviceProviderNumber.description: The service provider number. This is an identification number assigned by the payer.

servicesPlanID.description: The Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) Plan ID.

aaaErrors.description: When a payer rejects your eligibility check, the response contains one or more `AAA` errors that specify the reasons for the rejection and any recommended follow-up actions. Common reasons for rejection at the `provider` level include missing or incorrect information and issues with the provider's NPI registration with the payer. [Learn more](https://www.stedi.com/docs/healthcare/eligibility-troubleshooting#payer-aaa-errors)
